perturbation.changed_text: (n) “Territory” shall mean areas mutually agreed upon in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Territory' is specific and legally binding. Changing it to 'areas mutually agreed upon' introduces ambiguity, contradicting established international business standards that require clear geographic definitions in contracts. This vagueness affects enforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Enforceability, International Business Law - Territorial Rights

perturbation.original_text:
(q) “VOD” shall mean a system that allows for the exhibition of video programming chosen by a
subscriber for display on that subscriber’s video display unit on an on-demand basis, such that a
subscriber is able, at his or her discretion, to select the time for commencement of exhibition,
and shall include subscription VOD (“SVOD”), transactional VOD (“TVOD”), ad-supported VOD (“AVOD”)
and free VOD.
perturbation.changed_text: (q) “VOD” shall mean a method of distributing video content. The specifics of its implementation, including user control and revenue models, are subject to change without notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of VOD is specific, detailing user control and various models (SVOD, TVOD, etc.). The modified definition removes specifics, creating conflict by making essential components discretionary. This deviates from industry norms for VOD services.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Specificity of Terms, Digital Media Distribution Standards

perturbation.original_text:
i. license, exhibit, distribute, reproduce, transmit, perform, display, and
otherwise exploit and make available each Title within the Territory in any language by
VOD (including SVOD, TVOD, AVOD and free VOD) for Internet, TV and mobile platforms
(including, but not limited to, OTT streaming services, Sites and Mobile Sites), subject
to these limitations for each of the Title in Schedule A1-A6:
perturbation.changed_text:
i. license, exhibit, distribute, reproduce, transmit, perform, display, and
otherwise exploit and make available each Title within the Territory in any language by
VOD (including SVOD, TVOD, AVOD and free VOD) for Internet, TV and mobile platforms
(including, but not limited to, OTT streaming services, Sites and Mobile Sites), subject
to limitations determined at licensee discretion:
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly indicates that rights are granted subject to limitations outlined in Schedule A1-A6. Changing this to limitations determined at the licensee's discretion, gives the licensee unilateral power to change the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Unilateral Amendment; Good Faith
